isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1997) - SECTION 5.1: DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS - BEYERS MODEL 200 PRESSURE TEST KIT (ZTSE-2239)

svcproc.title: DESCRIPTION
svcproc.para:
The Pressure Test Kit (Figure 5.10)
can be used to measure intake manifold (Boost) pressure, fuel pressure, air cleaner restriction, fuel restriction, exhaust back pressure and crankcase pressure. It may also be used to test the accuracy of the gauges within the kit.
The 0-30 psi gauge may be used to measure fuel pressure or intake manifold (Boost) pressure.
The 0-30 in. Hg. vacuum gauge (0-14.7 psi), is used to measure fuel system inlet restriction.
The 0-60 inches of water (magnehelic) gauge (0-2.16 psi), may be used to measure air cleaner restriction or crankcase pressure.

caution.para: The quick disconnects have shut-off valves in the panel connectors not in the plug. DO NOT connect or disconnect lines while under pressure.

note.para: When using the magnehelic gauge, be sure to plug the test line into the proper ("Pressure" or "Vacuum") port. Use the "Pressure" port to read exhaust back pressure and crankcase pressure. Use "Vacuum" port to read air cleaner restriction. In both cases, THE OPPOSITE CONNECTOR MUST BE VENTED TO THE ATMOSPHERE BY INSTALLING A QUICK CONNECTIVE PLUG IN THE PORT.

svcproc.para: The 0-160 psi gauge may be used to check fuel pressure.
The 0-300 psi gauge is not normally used for any engine diagnostic check.
